messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Eurkea moments
messages.msgSnippet: On Sun, 09 Sep 2001 11:52:42 -0700 Pam Hartley ... people. ... and ... freakin ... So you are saying that I am imaginingit all.  I was not told this is not
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 09 Sep 2001 11:52:42 -0700 Pam Hartley
<pamhartley@...> writes:
>
>
> Pam
>
> P.S. Oh! I almost forgot: bashing ideas is different than bashing
people.
> You could say, "Pam, to think thus and such is a boogerheaded notion"
and
> that's bashing an idea. You could also say, "Pam, you are one giant
freakin'
> boogerhead" and that's bashing a person. Sincerely, Your Mailing List
> Tipster

So you are saying that I am imaginingit all. I was not told this is not
the list for me, that I am not unschooling (even after I went and read
the website), that I was not called authoritarian? Oh and by the way I
did not say Sondra said all that - others participated too.
I am merely hoping to get you to see how inhospitable this list has been
to me since day one, before I even mentioned what we have for family
dynamics. And it is not so much for myself - I don't particularly care
what you think of me - I just would hate to see you scare off someone who
really could use the reassurance that less is better in education
micro-management.

Bridget


~~~~If electricity comes from electrons...does that mean that morality
comes from morons?~~~~
I sent my Soul through the Invisible,
Some letter of that After-life to spell;
And by and by my Soul returned to me,
And answered, "I Myself am Heaven and Hell." -- The Rubaiyat

messages.subject: Re: Eurkea moments
messages.msgSnippet: ... over keyboard, going days without food or drink if necessary, just waiting for a newcomer to drop by and say, Hi! I m new and I m here to talk about
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1438
>Date: Sun, Sep 9, 2001, 9:44 AM
>

> I've chosen to stay because a few OTHER people have said things to make
> me think perhaps you are one of only a few here who are willing to bash a
> newcomer before you have any idea about their philosophy, family life or
> educational style.


:::Pam pauses with far-away look in eyes, tries to picture Sandra poised
over keyboard, going days without food or drink if necessary, just waiting
for a newcomer to drop by and say, "Hi! I'm new and I'm here to talk about
unschooling!" so she (Sandra) can bash them. Perhaps she even has a nice big
hammer sitting at the side of her keyboard to give her inspiration? No, no,
that would be over-the-top.:::

Sorry, it's not washing, even as fiction.

The list had its ideas about your philosophy, family life and educational
styles that you gave us. People were working on ideas-as-presented, not on
no-ideas.

Pam

P.S. Oh! I almost forgot: bashing ideas is different than bashing people.
You could say, "Pam, to think thus and such is a boogerheaded notion" and
that's bashing an idea. You could also say, "Pam, you are one giant freakin'
boogerhead" and that's bashing a person. Sincerely, Your Mailing List
Tipster
